1.text: And Eliphaz the Temanite answereth and saith:—

2.text: To God is a man profitable, Because a wise man to himself is profitable?

3.text: Is it a delight to the Mighty One That thou art righteous? is it gain, That thou makest perfect thy ways?

4.text: Because of thy reverence Doth He reason with thee? He entereth with thee into judgment:

5.text: Is not thy wickedness abundant? And there is no end to thine iniquities.

6.text: For thou takest a pledge of thy brother for nought, And the garments of the naked Thou dost strip off.

7.text: Thou causest not the weary to drink water, And from the hungry thou withholdest bread.

8.text: As to the man of arm—he hath the earth, And the accepted of face—he dwelleth in it.

9.text: Widows thou hast sent away empty, And the arms of the fatherless are bruised.

10.text: Therefore round about thee are snares, And trouble thee doth fear suddenly.

11.text: Or darkness—thou dost not see, And abundance of waters doth cover thee.

12.text: Is not God high in heaven? And see the summit of the stars, That they are high.

13.text: And thou hast said, ‘What—hath God known? Through thickness doth He judge?

14.text: Thick clouds are a secret place to Him, And He doth not see;’ And the circle of the heavens He walketh habitually,

15.text: The path of the age dost thou observe, That men of iniquity have trodden?

16.text: Who have been cut down unexpectedly, A flood is poured out on their foundation.

17.text: Those saying to God, ‘Turn aside from us,’ And what doth the Mighty One to them?

18.text: And he hath filled their houses with good: (And the counsel of the wicked Hath been far from me.)

19.text: See do the righteous and they rejoice, And the innocent mocketh at them,

20.text: ‘Surely our substance hath not been cut off, And their excellency hath fire consumed.’

21.text: Acquaint thyself, I pray thee, with Him, And be at peace, Thereby thine increase is good.

22.text: Receive, I pray thee, from His mouth a law, And set His sayings in thy heart.

23.text: If thou dost return unto the Mighty Thou art built up, Thou puttest iniquity far from thy tents.

24.text: So as to set on the dust a defence, And on a rock of the valleys a covering.

25.text: And the Mighty hath been thy defence, And silver is strength to thee.

26.text: For then on the Mighty thou delightest thyself, And dost lift up unto God thy face,

27.text: Thou dost make supplication unto Him, And He doth hear thee, And thy vows thou completest.

28.text: And thou decreest a saying, And it is established to thee, And on thy ways hath light shone.

29.text: For they have made low, And thou sayest, ‘Lift up.’ And the bowed down of eyes he saveth.

30.text: He delivereth the not innocent, Yea, he hath been delivered By the cleanness of thy hands.
